summary: Task management app: add Notion-style full-page task editor (one page per task) plus a left slide-out side menu with always-visible top-left toggle, searchable/scrollable task list, and ultra-fast quick-add to create many tasks via Enter.
architectural_notes: Introduce full-page task route/page (e.g., /task/:id) that loads a task and edits its long-form content.
Side menu is a toggleable left drawer accessible via persistent top-left button; includes searchable scrollable task list and quick-add.
known_issues: UI/CSS regression: side menu, quick-add, new tasks, and full-page task route render but are effectively invisible/unusable due to missing/incorrect backgrounds/colors (solid panel styling needed).

existing_features.title: Add a full-page task route/view so each task can be opened and edited on its own page (Notion-style), including a large markdown/rich editor area for long-form task content.

Create a left slide-out side menu (task drawer) that can be opened/closed via an always-visible top-left toggle button, and that contains: (1) a search input, (2) a scrollable list of all tasks, and (3) a super-fast quick-add input that creates a new independent task on Enter without opening the full-page editor.
Enable fast navigation between tasks from the task drawer by selecting a task in the list to open that taskâ€™s full-page view.

Update existing task entry points so users can reach the full-page task view with minimal friction from the current UI (e.g., task cards / task lists), while preserving the ability to do quick edits if that still exists.

Update frontend React Query hooks and frontend types/usage to support fetching and saving the new long-form task content field (including invalidation so the full-page editor shows saved content after updates).

Add a coherent visual theme for the new full-page editor and task drawer (colors, typography, spacing, and interaction states) and apply it consistently across these new surfaces without introducing blue/purple as the primary theme colors.

Ensure dark theme CSS variables apply globally so backgrounds, panels, and text colors render correctly across the entire app (including the Task Drawer and full-page Task Page). Do this without modifying any files under frontend/src/hooks/* (immutable paths).

Fix the Task Drawer (left Sheet) styling so it always displays as a solid, clearly visible panel with correct background, foreground, borders, and layering; the search input, quick-add input, buttons, and task list items must be visible and interactable.

Fix the full-page Task Page styling so the editor route displays a solid, readable layout (top bar + content area) with correct backgrounds and readable text, including the long-form rich text editor area.

new_feature_requests.summary: Notion-style full-page task view/editor (one page per task) with markdown/rich editing and persistent task content field
Left slide-out side menu with always-visible top-left toggle button and scrollable list of all tasks
Task search/filter inside side menu for fast navigation between tasks
Ultra-fast quick-add input in side menu: press Enter to create a new independent task without opening the full page

Extend the backend Task data model to persist a long-form task content field (separate from the existing short description) and provide backend APIs to read and update this content for a task with the same ownership/permission checks as other task updates.
If the Task data model is changed in a way that affects stable storage across upgrades, add a conditional Motoko migration (backend/migration.mo) so existing deployed state can be upgraded safely.

projectName: Notion-style full-page task editor with slide-out task drawer (search + quick add)
